The left choice provides a significant advantage to me, but results in nothing for Person A. The right choice provides a more equitable distribution. Even though I am not explicitly incentivized for fairness, given my research interests which intersect with questions of healthy brains, I can support the equitable option. However, the difference in payoff is substantial (200), so this makes it harder to sacrifice this amount.
